Event.name: Change_of_temperature
Event.definition:
<def-root>In this frame, the temperature of an <fen>Item</fen> changes. An <fen>Initial_temperature</fen>, <fen>Final_temperature</fen>, or <fen>Temperature_change</fen> can also be indicated.
<ex><fex name="Item">The house</fex> had <t>cooled</t> <t>off</t> <fex name="Temperature_change">by a few more degrees</fex> <fex name="Time">by midnight</fex>, and we finally managed to eat a bite.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_temperature
Arg.definition: <def-root>The temperature that the <fen>Item</fen> has prior to the event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Final_temperature
Arg.definition: <def-root>The temperature of the <fen>Item</fen> after the event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Temperature_change
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of difference between the <fen>Initial_temperature</fen> and the <fen>Final_temperature</fen> of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Hot_cold_source
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Hot_cold_source</fen> is the source of the heat or coolness</def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event or state-of-affairs that leads to the change in temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Container
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Container</fen> that holds the <fen>Item</fen> whose temperature is being changed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Item</fen> during the temperature change.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The span of time in which the <fen>Item</fen> is changing temperature.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the change in temperature occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the <fen>Item</fen> changes temperature.</def-root>

Arg.name: Subregion
Arg.definition: <def-root>A portion of the <fen>Item</fen> which is affected by the temperature change.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The manner in which the <fen>Item</fen> changes temperature.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the temperature change occurs</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Item</fen> that results from the temperature change.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

Arg.name: Temperature
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses. This FE is rarely expressed.
<ex>The raw fish that is to be eaten as sushi has to be meticulously prepared and must first be <t>chilled</t> <fex name="Temp">in temperature</fex> to exactly above freezing point.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the change in temperature takes place.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: cool.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: reach or approach a fairly low temperature

lexUnit.name: heat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move from a cooler temperature to a warmer one

lexUnit.name: refrigerate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become cooler in temperature by being placed in a refrigerator

lexUnit.name: reheat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become warm once again by being subjected to an energy source which gives out heat

lexUnit.name: warm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become higher in temperature by being subjected to a heat source

lexUnit.name: cool off.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause a relative decrease in temperature
